This Game is amazing in anyway possible, the story is really mind blowing and with a deep suspense behind it, it takes quite some language skills to understand the words you will read, however, gameplay is just great. Get it now!

title.label: Glad I took a chance on this game!

content.label: Iâ€™m weary of games you have to pay for before you can even play. I wish iTunes allowed you to try games out for a short period of time before you decided to purchase. Which is why Iâ€™m always reluctant to play games you have to buy before you can even download them. This game sparked my interest and I took a chance on it and am so glad I did. I absolutely loved it! Itâ€™s unique, easy game play, makes you think and plan ahead, choose your own path/story - basically everything I love in a game! Download it - you wonâ€™t be disappointed!

I'm not much of a game player but I was going on a trip, so I googled games and this one came up as one of the most popular, best games, so I got it. I have gone around the world now four times, and each time I learned some new things about the planet, different countries, oceans, cities, etc. I had to look up cities and countries on maps. We died once at the North Pole because we thought it would be brilliant to make the smallest circumference; another time we  didn't intend to go there but made a navigation mistake and almost died but were rescued and made it around the world in 64 or 65 days. On another trip we were a few days late and lost the wager. We went around the world again and made it in about 74 days.  I've learned that when the valet makes the wisest, less reckless decisions, we do better. If he picks up something not his, he suffers the consequences. If he goes for an evening walk, he might gather useful information or he might get pick-pocketed or arrested. Take notes, useful for other trips. Buy maps at new markets so you get more routes, then sell them.  Take care of Monsieur Fogg. Buy items at markets that you can later sell. Occasionally earn extra money doing chores at your hotel.  Make friends. Make sure you have enough money by visiting banks. New York to London by airship is a good route. Engage in conversations and read the news occasionally.   Love and compassion usually have good outcomes. This is a great game. 5 stars.
The gameplay is so unique and there are so many story possibilities, definitely worth buying!

Though I tend to play quite a large amount of games on my iPhone, I very rarely write reviews for them. However, this game is absolutely superb and well-deserving of one. 
I'm on my third play-through now, and definitely foresee myself going through it at least several more times. The different routes and stories available make it so that you get a wildly different story every time and I sincerely enjoy consciously taking new paths each time. Additionally, the writing is above par for an app of this nature. 
Very fun and refreshing game given the quality of what is typically on the App Store. Couldn't possibly recommend it more than I do. Enjoy, all.

This game is so great! Itâ€™s like a steampunk version of Carmen Sandiego. I just keep playing it over and over and itâ€™s a totally different adventure each time. The possibilities are endless. Best game Iâ€™ve played in 2017.

title.label: Amazing! My favorite iOS game of all time.

content.label: I got 80 days a few years ago, and have been obsessively playing it since. The beautiful writing, combined with the awesome design, and everything else combines to create a extremely good game. The cost is worth it; I would spend much much more for it if I needed to.
I when i first got this I thought this would be boring but itâ€™s amazing it has an almost unlimited replay ability
I can play this over and over! Just wish there were a few variations on scenarios on the more steadily taken routes. Waiting for interesting updates :)

I love this game. I've played it at least 100 times and still finding some new twists.

But! I would love an update, with more cities and travel options, ability to travel west, or change direction when necessary- and maybe rewind ability like in the Sorcery games? Definitely more cities though, please!
It's one of my favs

title.label: Wish I could give it 5 stars.....

content.label:
The game is fun. But, once you play it 1-2 times, you'll want new challenges. The app has Game Center achievements & challenges but no ability to SEE what you've earned or what is left to earn. That's really stupid.  Makes re-play pointless. 

Also, the game should keep track of your statistics of past games played. Such as- most money earned, fastest trip, etc. 

Without these simple features, the game is really only good for one round. And for $4.99- one round of the game is expensive and not a good value since the graphics are simple, it's mostly a reading game and in-game functions are not well explained.

Having already played this for many hours on PC I was more than happy to buy it again for iPhone, due to the incredible depth of experience it offers and the boundless opportunities its gameplay beckons you with.  Suffice to say I love it; love, slavery, war, lost civilizations and more make certain to fuel a markedly different experience each time you play it. Hurry if you want, languish if you prefer ... the point of this game is not the destination, it is the journey.  Inkle's best yet.
Not really a game, more like an interactive book. Super boring.

As a kid, I read all of Jules Verne's books. The brilliance with which he wrote with is captured in this beautifully artistic and rich game. I absolutely love it and believe I have made an exceptional purchase.

Love the steampunk take on a classic; it still has the old world charm with the intrigued of something new and innovative. Multiple branching means you can play this game over and over again and discover hidden quests and plot lines.

The developers have created a detailed world where the Victorian age is mixed with a futuristic fantasy of incredible inventions.  I know I will be playing this again to check out more routes, locations and characters.
(Added: I don't know any other adventure type game as enjoyably replayable as this.  After 7 completed trips, I'm still not even close to being done discovering all the richly described places, journeys, characters, fantastical inventions and adventures.  It's a game created to be played again and again,  since more possibilities appear on subsequent plays. This is an amazing game . )

I really enjoy playing this game. I've played it about 15 times and have had a lot of fun adventures.  This game could have easily been 5 stars if it had a little more game play to it. I read people's reviews and they say how it's a different adventure every time. It seems like there should be a few a little more to it. Maybe some other ways to make money , gambling or investing in something , maybe even a heist. Also maybe more items to barter with , too many items only sell well at one city. The narrative is great , the sound effects are fantastic. Looking forward to a sequel. Thanks for a great game Inkle !
This game is by far the greatest app I've ever played. The amount of hours fun I've had playing this game it is definitely one of the stories I'll never forget

I really enjoy the game, going around the world seems like a fantastic adventure. At times I wish I was traveling with them using those fantastic traveling machines. 
My only suggestion would be to make the clock more accessible, many times I try to type it to make the time go faster but it would work at ransoms or not work at all.

There is almost no greater feeling in the world than bundling up with a hot cup of coffee in one hand, and an iPod playing 80 Days in the other. I never been much of a reader at all, considering the fact that I've never read a single novel in my entire life. However I have always been an avid gamer, specifically in the RPG genre which usually includes a butt load of reading as it is, and luckily even though 80 Days is especially just a reading game, it's built upon the framework of a true video game so I feel right at home. I absolutely love all of the different stories and routes one can take in a single play through, and with 169 cities and a plethora of different dialogue options to choose from, 80 Days turns in to one of the if not THE most re-playable video game of all time!!! I can't say enough good things about this game!! It has a very strong Oregon   Trail vibe to it, and while you can never truly lose like I'm Oregon Trail, there are tons of different disastrous things that can happen along the way which can eat up valuable time. From crash landing in the ocean, to contracting Cholera, to being arrested and thrown in jail, there is never a shortage of wonderful adventures to be had. I am on my 4th play through and it feels every bit as fresh as the first, and I expect that same replay value to last a hundred plays or more!! This is truly one of the very best games I have ever played period!!!

Each time around the world differs. Choose your own path, buy and sell to get yourself and your master around the globe, but be sure to be a respectable valet. The only disappointment I have is that no other games can live up to this one. I've even purchased games by the same maker and they don't even come close.

This is just an amazing game.  Maybe the best I've played on iOS. It's fresh, smart, and compelling. The production value is very high, and it's so atmospheric and evocative. It does an excellent job of communicating the excitement and adventure of a time when the world was just starting to open up to travel, but before the homogenization brought about by mass communication and affordable air travel. This game would be a bargain at twice the price.

This game is awesome. I played it 5 times already since I bought it. However, I wish there is more detail about the relationship between the valet and Fogg. I have no idea how that works. 

Also, country names on the map would make this game better.

80 Days is one of or the most unique games I have owned, and it is extremely fun. The amount of choice and openness makes you feel as if you are actually in the story. You get to choose everything from when to depart, where to go, and even what to buy! The branching story really makes the game feel engaging and fun. This is a game that I am very happy with. It deserves 5 stars easily, and is worth the money.

I think this game is laudable, and I wanted to love it more. The texts and the lingo very quickly begin to be tiresome, and the stories hard to follow. Moreover, they then help much if at all with the game. Btw, I eon the first time, and no plan to re-play it again. The game shows love and is well crafted, and most 5 stars are understandable of you like the text, which I did not.

Amazing!

I just finished playing this game through for probably the thirtieth time or so, and I have once again discovered new stories, new interactions, and a new route across the world. It is reading intensive, but I love the rich, detailed world that was created for this game, it keeps me interested in replaying so that I can learn something new about it. 

10/10 will play again ðŸ™ƒ
Kinda a stupid, boring game. Feel like I wasted my time trying to get into it.

This is a fantastic game with some of the best writing you will ever find. It is very replayable, as you can go through the game a dozen times without exploring every part of the story. This is simply one of the best games out there.
The UI is eh but past that the game is beautiful
